convoturns.lexia: Be straight with me, Hayley.
Aren't I always?
Seriously. What's up?
Nothing. It's... It's not that I don't want to go, Frankie, it's just that...
I can't.
Why?
Dancing! My gross body dancing!
disgusting
I can't dance
It's not ballet. It's just bodies moving. Body positivity, yeah?
But I don't feel positive about my body.
You don't have to. I don't. Hardly ever. But it doesn't matter, everyone's accepted.
How can you know that?
It's bopo!
Everyone dancing, loving their bodies!
No, no, no, no.
But you said you liked the idea. I thought you wanted to go.
Yes, for your sake... because, you know... I wanted to be supportive, but...
Well, come along. Be supportive.
I want to but... not dancing in front of people!
They won't be looking at you.
Smirking, sniggering.
I can't, Frankie. Don't make me.
You can't keep missing out on life.
Stop pressurizing me.
Okay, okay. I just thought... If you hadn't said...
I know, Frankie. I know I said I'd be there for you. And I am... Here for you, I mean. But not...
Not there.
Sorry, Frankie. I'd go with you if I could.
Okay, okay. I get it. I get it.
You don't, Frankie. You don't know what it's like for me.
Don't I? Let me tell you something, Hayley.
I used to hate my body. Really hate it. Never felt comfortable in it.
Like you were in the wrong body?
What would be the right body?
What's non-binary supposed to look like? Where are all the NB celebs? The NB influencers?
No role models?
Everyone saw me as a girl. My parents wanted me to be a girl. Everyone did.
But it never felt right to me. Never.
So when I was a teenager I automatically thought I must be the opposite. I wanted to be a man.
And I tried, you know, to be completely masculine. But that didn't feel right either.
Of course not. I get that.
What I'm trying to say is, I automatically went to the opposite. I was still stuck in that binary idea.
Like there's only two genders?
Yes. But don't get me wrong, for some people transitioning is positively the right thing to do. Just not for me.
Sure.
And it made me hate my body, really hate it.
I know what you mean.
It was like being at war with myself.
I had to find some peace.
Peace? P e a c e
Hippy dippy shit
But peace...
Hey! Got a full-length mirror?
Never use it.
Where is it?
In the bedroom. Why?
Let me show you something. Something that helped me.
